channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shopping trolley abandoned on the pavement., 6th February
item.description:
Please can you remove the abandoned shopping trolley on the pavement outside lower Sydenham station opposite the bowls club entrance? There is also a wheelie bin been left there as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westerley Crescent, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Illegal HMO, 6th February
item.description:
Illegal HMO subletting multiple rooms to tenants. Commercial bin driveway for residential property use.

item.title: The marked parking bays in Hansol Road have almost faded away, 6th February
item.description:
The marked bays (where cars are allowed to partially park on the pavement) are now so faded as to be invisible especially at night or in adverse weather. They could really do with repainting to minimise the chance of motorists parking incorrectly. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hansol Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leafing not cleared in section of Arbor Close, 6th February
item.description:
The workers who cleared the leaves a week ago missed off this section which is easily missed but is in fact part of the public footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arbor Close, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Dumped fridges, 6th February
item.description:
Dumped fridges or freezers by lamppost seems to be a common of occurrence down here? Imagine the revenue if you put up cameras & caught & fined the scum?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitefoot Lane, Downham, Greater London

item.title: Gas canisters, 6th February
item.description:
Dumped gas canisters, bottles etc by tree. Been here weeks now do we actually have a road sweeper in this area?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitefoot Terrace, Downham, Greater London

item.title: Albamy Street/Chester Gate, 6th February
item.description:
Resident reports 3 way traffic lights not working, causing traffic chaos 24 hours a day. There is constant shouting, swearing and car horns, also workers being abused.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised advertising signs Dursley Road SE3, 6th February
item.description:
2 large signs have been erected on the street sign on both corners of Dursley Road and Holburne Road. I assume without permission

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dursley Road, Kidbrooke

item.title: Loose paving stone, water underneath, uneven paving, 6th February
item.description:
Outside #9 Rowben Close, the paving stone is loose and uneven. Walk on it if it's been raining and you'll get water in your shoe. Likelihood of someone tripping .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Rowben Close, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crack in road is started to sink, 6th February
item.description:
I am writing to you to raise an issue about: The road crack is quickly growing due to the large vehicles. A larger area surrounding the crack is starting to sink and will also fail in the near future. Due to the size and speed of vehicles using this road this is causing serious vibrations through my home especially at night time when there is no traffic and the buses have the freedom of the road, I welcome any inspection on my home to see the crack that this road has caused, the council should be liable due to poor maintenance. Please can this larger area be inspected/repaired asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 281, Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Flytipping on Stowage SE8 (by junction with Gonson Street)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stowage, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated General Household Waste Fly Tipping, 6th February
item.description:
I have reported this issue several times, eventually the offending waste will be cleared only to be quickly followed by a new occurrence. Latest issue was reported to LBG Street Team by phone Tues 27 Kan 26 on report reference SSR 1138467. Tried following up twice by phone and still hasn't been cleared.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunyard Mews, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole getting worse outside 281 burnt oak lane, 6th February
item.description:
Large pothole getting worse & causing all houses to shake as heavy vehicles hit it. The problem is caused by the B13 buses which use this road & are too heavy for this kind of street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
